intro: Diplanthera indica, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with five petals and a prominent yellow throat. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
